orbotix.robot.base
Class RobotProvider

java.lang.Object
  orbotix.robot.base.RobotProvider
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Observer
public class RobotProvider
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Observer

Discover and initiate connections to Orbotix Robots.

Nested Class Summary
static interface RobotProvider.OnNoRobotsPairedListener
          Deprecated. replaced with DiscoveryListener.discoveryComplete(java.util.List) with an empty list A listener to be run when no robots are paired to device
static interface RobotProvider.OnRobotConnectedListener
          Deprecated. replaced with ConnectionListener.onConnected(Robot) A listener to be run when a robot is connected.

          Deprecated. replaced with ConnectionListener.onConnectionFailed(Robot) A listener to be run when a robot failed to connect

getDefaultProvider

public static RobotProvider getDefaultProvider()
Get a handle on the default provider object.

Returns:
RobotProvider A singleton instance of the RobotProvider.

initiateConnection

public boolean initiateConnection(java.lang.String robotId)
Method to AutoConnect . This will start the discovery process, and attempt a connection to a lone Orbotix device or to the preferred Orbotix device when multiple devices are present.

Parameters:
robotId - The unique id of the preferred Orbotix device when multiple devices are present.
Returns:
if discovery process started successfully

isAdapterEnabled

public boolean isAdapterEnabled()
Deprecated. use addDiscoveryListener(orbotix.sphero.DiscoveryListener) to add discovery lifecycle listeners and then use startDiscovery() to start discovery.

Returns:
true if the adapter is enabled, otherwise, false.

public boolean startDiscovery(Context context)
Start Discovery using the context for broadcasting discovery lifecycle state changes

Returns:
if discovery process started successfully

connect

public void connect(Robot robot)
Requests a connection to a Robot. When connection is complete, ConnectionListener.onConnected(Robot) is fired.

Parameters:
robot -

connectControlledRobots

public java.lang.Boolean connectControlledRobots()
Attempts to connect to any Robots who have been set up to be controlled.

Returns:
true if connects are attempted, otherwise false if nothing needed connected.
See Also:
control(Robot)

disconnect

public void disconnect(Robot robot)

disconnectControlledRobots

public void disconnectControlledRobots()
Disconnects all robots that are under control without removing them from control.

hasRobotControl

public boolean hasRobotControl()
Method for testing that there is at least one robot to control.

Returns:
true if at least one robot is available to control, otherwise, false.

getRobotControls

public java.util.List<RobotControl> getRobotControls()

Returns:
Array of RobotControl objects.

getRobotControl

public RobotControl getRobotControl(Robot robot)
Gets the RobotControl object for a Robot object.

Parameters:
robot - The robot.
Returns:
The RobotControl for the robot, otherwise null if the robot is not under control.

findRobot

public Robot findRobot(java.lang.String robotId)
Finds a robot in the robot list by it's bluetooth address.

Parameters:
robotId - String id that for the robot.
Returns:
A Robot object.
